titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Suffolk County, New York subpoena records 1977.451
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:09:39 +0000.

did.unittitle: Suffolk County, New York subpoena records
did.abstract: The collection consists of two subpoenas concerning the court case of William Smith, circa 1700 to 1750. The proceedings concerned property boundaries and a trespassing charge.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1977.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Suffolk County, New York subpoena records, 1977.451, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
